173.article_body: A king cobra travelled in a car for over 200 km and lived in its engine bay for a week before being finally rescued by wildlife personnel in Kerala, according to the vehicle owner. The incident was reported from Kerala's Arpookara. The forest officials rescued the 10-foot-long snake from the compound of an individual, a video of which surfaced online.

174.title: Virat Kohli bowls in T20I cricket after 6 years, concedes 6 runs in an over
174.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Wednesday bowled an over against Hong Kong in their Asia Cup 2022 match. It is the first time since 2016 that Kohli bowled in a T20I match. He gave away six runs in his over. Kohli has bowled 25.2 overs in T20I cricket, taking four wickets for 204 runs.

175.title: Man steals 1-day-old infant from UP hospital by posing as hospital staff, video surfaces
175.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing a man stealing a one-day-old infant from a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. A complaint has been filed by the parents of the infant, in which they mentioned that the man posed as a hospital staff member for stealing the baby. The police has formed a team to nab the accused.

176.title: Nikhil Siddhartha's 'Karthikeya 2' crosses ₹100 crore at box office
176.article_body: Nikhil Siddhartha shared that his film 'Karthikeya 2' has "crossed the ₹100 crore gross mark officially" at the box office. The actor thanked the audience for their "love and affection" for the film. "Will always try and work hard to live up to it," he wrote. The film is being screened on over 3,000 screens across India.

177.title: Michael Jackson wanted to be in The Sandman's TV version: Neil Gaiman
177.article_body: 'The Sandman' author Neil Gaiman revealed that Michael Jackson wanted to play Morpheus in the television version of the comic book series. Remembering his visit to Warner Bros in 1996, Neil said that the then-president of the production house told him that Michael had called them to ask if he could be a part of the television adaptation.

178.title: Would like to work with Vijay in Ajay Gnanamuthu directorial: Vikram
178.article_body: Tamil actor Chiyaan Vikram has shared that he would like to work with his contemporary Vijay under the direction of filmmaker Ajay Gnanamuthu. Vikram spoke about Vijay during a Twitter conversation, which was conducted on Tuesday to promote his film 'Cobra'. In response, director Ajay Gnanamuthu said he would be the first person to buy a ticket for the film.

179.title: Learned how to face camera from Kareena: Kiara
179.article_body: Kiara Advani said she "learned how to face the camera" from her 'Good Newwz' co-star Kareena Kapoor Khan. She said during the film's shoot, she used to be so involved in a scene that she would forget about camera angles. However, that never happened with Kareena. Kiara said Kareena "would know where the camera is, even if it's behind her".

180.title: S Korea may hold survey on BTS members' mandatory military service
180.article_body: South Korea is considering a survey to determine whether members of K-pop band BTS should be granted exemptions from mandatory military service, officials said. The Defence Ministry is examining the adequacy of such a study. The military service issue has been debated in the media recently as BTS's oldest member, Jin, faces enlistment at year-end, when he turns 30.

181.title: EU to toughen travel rules for Russian tourists, no ban imposed
181.article_body: European Union countries on Wednesday agreed to make it tougher for Russian citizens to enter the 27-nation bloc, but failed to develop consensus on imposing an outright ban on tourists. EU foreign ministers made the decision in retaliation to Russia's war on Ukraine. The plan is to lengthen the process to obtain short-term visas to enter Europe's passport-free travel zone.

182.title: Would have quit politics earlier if I knew it would be dirty: Mamata
182.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that she would have quit politics much earlier if she was aware that it could get so dirty and her family and she would face slander. Her statement comes in reaction to a recent PIL filed at Calcutta High Court demanding probe by central agencies into the assets of her family members.

183.title: Dennis Woodside appointed as President of Freshworks
183.article_body: Nasdaq-listed software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Freshworks has appointed Dennis Woodside as the company's President, effective from September 1. Woodside will join the company's board of directors and will report to Freshworks CEO and Founder Girish Mathrubootham. Previously, he was President of Impossible Foods, and also worked at Dropbox and Google. At Freshworks, he will lead global business operations.

184.title: PM Modi performs 'aarti' at Piyush Goyal's residence on Ganesh Chaturthi
184.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi performed 'aarti' at the residence of Union Minister Piyush Goyal on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi on Wednesday. A video showed the PM greeting Goyal and others before offering prayers and performing 'aarti'. Sharing pictures from Goyal's residence, the PM tweeted, "May the blessings of Bhagwan Shri Ganesh always remain upon us."

185.title: Crediting Mughals for uniting India 'absurd and false': Baba Ramdev
185.article_body: Responding to Assam Congress MP Abdul Khaliq , who said that the Mughals were responsible for unification of India, Baba Ramdev said that crediting the Mughals for India's unification was 'absurd and false.' Calling the Mughals 'invaders,' Ramdev further added that glorifying them for uniting India 'shows a colonial mindset.' Khaliq had added that he was proud of the Mughals.

186.title: Healthcare facility for advocates to open soon: K'taka CM Bommai
186.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said healthcare facility for advocates would open soon, adding ₹800 crore would be spent to improve the judiciary's infrastructure. "This'll ensure good facilities in lower courts. As the population grows, court facilities must be upgraded," Bommai said. The government has given permission for having the bar associations in Shiggaon, Savanur and Haveri, he added.

187.title: Railways completes construction of 9.8 km tunnel in J&K
187.article_body: A 9.8-km tunnel on the 111-km under-construction Katra-Banihal railway link in Jammu and Kashmir has been completed, officials said. The tunnel connects Dugga and Sawlakote stations. The railway link is part of the 272-km Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Railway Line (USBRL) project. The Katra-Banihal section includes 35 tunnels and 37 bridges.

188.title: Elephant dies at UP's Dudhwa National Park
188.article_body: An elephant, who was suffering from liver complications, has passed away at Uttar Pradesh's Dudhwa National Park, officials said. "The elephant was suffering from liver complications for the past three months," said Field director, Dudhwa, Sanjay Kumar Pathak. He added that the female elephant was given regular medications and despite that her condition did not improve.

189.title: SC to hear plea on mechanism to probe sexual harassment cases against judges
189.article_body: Supreme Court will hear a plea by a law intern on framing guidelines to probe sexual harassment cases against sitting and retired judges in November. It has also sought its Secretary-General's stand on the enquiry mechanism. While hearing the intern's sexual harassment complaint against an ex-judge in 2014, the court had noted that there's no enquiry mechanism for such complaints.

190.title: Hindus, Muslims come together to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi in K'taka
190.article_body: People from Muslim and Hindu communities came together to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi in Karnataka's Mandya district on Wednesday. As per reports, people from both the communities had gathered at Beedi Colony, which has a majority of Muslims. A video of their participation in the celebrations has emerged online. Notably, this comes amid Idgah ground dispute in Karnataka's Hubballi and Chamrajpet.

191.title: Internet shutdowns hit Lebanon as telecom workers go on strike
191.article_body: Major internet shutdowns hit cash-strapped Lebanon this week as employees of the state-owned telecom company went on strike, demanding increase in wages. Lebanon is experiencing one of its worst economic crises which has seen three-fourths of its 6-million population enter poverty level. The Lebanese pound lost over 90% of its value against the US dollar in the last three years.

192.title: Excessive flooding could lead to health crisis in Pakistan: WHO
192.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday warned that the excessive flooding in Pakistan this monsoon could lead to a health crisis. The rains have destroyed or damaged nearly 900 clinics and hospitals and damage to infrastructure has meant health services are not reaching remote areas. WHO has also said there is a possibility of waterborne diseases spreading rapidly.

193.title: No state funeral for Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev: Russian media
193.article_body: There will be no state funeral for the ex-president of the Soviet Union, Mikhail Gorbachev, Russian media reported on Wednesday. Gorbachev's funeral will reportedly take place inside Moscow's House of Unions and he will likely be buried at the city's Novodevichy Cemetery, next to his wife, Raisa, who died in 1999. The funeral will reportedly take place on Saturday.

194.title: Reliance Industries acquires soft drink brand Campa: Report
194.article_body: Reliance Industries has acquired soft drink brand Campa from Pure Drinks Group to add to its FMCG portfolio, as per reports. The deal is estimated to be ₹22 crore and Reliance is looking to re-launch Campa nationally by Diwali in three flavours. This will include its original Campa Cola, lemon and orange variants.

195.title: NPCI receives RBI nod to acquire 10% stake in ONDC
195.article_body: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has received clearance from Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and Union Ministry of Finance to acquire a 10% stake in Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC). Reportedly, Bank of India is also looking to acquire 5-7% stake in the company. ONDC currently has 17 stakeholders, and is aiming to have 20.

196.title: Russian missile strikes kill 22 at train station on Ukraine's Independence Day
196.article_body: At least 22 people were killed and several others wounded in Russian missile strikes on Chaplyne railway station in Ukraine on Wednesday, which was Ukraine's Independence Day. As per Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, rockets also hit a train following which four carriages caught fire. "We'll definitely make the occupiers bear responsibility for everything they have done," Zelenskyy stated.

197.title: BJP, BJYM workers try to gherao Chhattisgarh CM's house; 460 detained
197.article_body: Leaders and workers of BJP and its youth wing BJYM tried to gherao Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel's residence on Wednesday. They were protesting against alleged corruption and unemployment in Chhattisgarh. Police said 461 protesters, including MP Arun Sao, were briefly detained. Around 15 officers were injured while trying to control the protesters at various places in the state, police added.

198.title: Theft suspect in Gujarat's Vadodara dies in police custody
198.article_body: A theft suspect detained in Gujarat's Vadodara died in police custody, an official said. The man, identified as Bhupendra Solanki, was caught while committing theft at a residential society at Sevasi, a police official said. However, a resident of the area said that Solanki was his guest and lost his way when people caught him on suspicion.

199.title: CBI raids residence of Bengal university VC in recruitment scam case
199.article_body: The CBI on Wednesday raided the house and office of former SSC Chairman and present Vice Chancellor of University of North Bengal, Subires Bhattacharyya, in connection with the West Bengal teacher recruitment scam case. Notably, the Bag committee had mentioned Bhattacharyya's name in its report while probing the scam. Earlier, ex-minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested in connection with the case.

200.title: Assam Legislative Assembly autumn session to commence from Sept 12
200.article_body: The autumn session of the Assam Legislative Assembly will commence from September 12 and will continue till September 19. The monsoon session of the Assembly which began on July 18, ended four days ahead of its scheduled end date of August 12. The Governor of Assam, Prof Jagdish Mukhi, summoned the autumn session.

201.title: Even when we remember that today, we can't sleep: Kapil Dev on loss to Pakistan in 1986
201.article_body: Recalling the 1986 Austral-Asia Cup final which India lost to Pakistan after Javed Miandad slammed a last-ball six against Chetan Sharma, former India captain Kapil Dev said, "Even when we remember that today, we can't sleep." He added, "That defeat crushed the whole side's confidence for the next four years." He further said that the defeat wasn't Chetan's mistake.

202.title: It was really good: Danny DeVito on SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'
202.article_body: Actor Danny DeVito said he found SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' and Shahid Kapoor's 'R...Rajkumar' "really good". He said he loved how the Indian films "keep up the story even in the singing". Danny said whenever he can, he would like to convince the makers of his animated show 'Little Demon' to bust into a big number in the next season.

203.title: US sending fresh military aid to Ukraine worth nearly $3 billion
203.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said he is sending fresh military aid worth $2.98 billion to Ukraine in its war against Russia. Biden said the support will help Ukraine acquire air defense systems, artillery systems, munitions, drones and other equipment. “The United States of America is committed to supporting the people of Ukraine as they...defend their sovereignty,” Biden said.

204.title: What is govt's new model for toll collection on highways?
204.article_body: The government is planning to replace toll plazas with Automatic Number Plate Reader (ANPR) cameras. As per the plan, the cameras will read high-security registration plates (HSRPs) on the vehicles and toll will be automatically deducted from the linked bank accounts of vehicle owners. The government is planning to bring a provision for all vehicles to have HSRPs.

205.title: My focus remains on how relatable my character can be: Pankaj
205.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said the look of his character doesn't matter to him as an actor. He said his focus remains on creating characters that are so relatable that whenever the audience sees him on screen, they should feel they know someone similar. But for Pankaj, the trick is to do it "while maintaining a certain uniqueness about it".

206.title: F1 driver Daniel Ricciardo to leave McLaren after 2022 season
206.article_body: Formula One driver Daniel Ricciardo has announced that the current 2022 season will be his last year at McLaren. McLaren and Ricciardo have "mutually agreed" to terminate his contract one year early. The Australian had joined McLaren for 2021 on a three-year deal. Ricciardo is the only McLaren driver to have won a Formula One race in the last decade.

207.title: COVID-19 deaths fall by 15% worldwide: WHO in weekly report
207.article_body: The number of COVID-19 deaths dipped by 15% worldwide and new infections dropped by 9%, the World Health Organization (WHO) said in its weekly assessment on Wednesday. In total, the WHO said 5.3 million new cases and over 14,000 deaths were reported last week. The health body said number of new infections fell in every region, except the Western Pacific.

208.title: Nearly 500 schemes announced by Jayalalithaa shelved: AIADMK's EPS
208.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday criticised the ruling DMK and accused them of shelving nearly 500 projects announced by late AIADMK leader J Jayalalithaa. This deprives people of various welfare measures, he said. Expansion of Coimbatore airport and Avinashi Athikadavu water project were some of the schemes kept pending, he added.

209.title: TVS Motor buys 48% stake in Narain Karthikeyan’s startup DriveX
209.article_body: Two and three-wheeler manufacturer TVS Motor has invested in former Formula 1 driver Narain Karthikeyan's startup to acquire 48.27% stake. TVS has invested over ₹85 crore in DriveX (NKars Mobility Millennial Solutions Private Limited), a pre-owned two-wheeler platform. DriveX was founded in April 2020 and began as a two-wheeler subscription platform, and has since spread to five cities.

210.title: Pepperfry acquires Brandmakerr, appoints Rahul Kapuria as VP
210.article_body: Furniture e-commerce company Pepperfry has acquired commercial interior solutions company Brandmakerr for an undisclosed amount. Pepperfry has appointed Brandmakerr founder, Rahul Kapuria, as the Vice President. With this deal, Pepperfry said it will foray into commercial projects in retail, banking and HORECA (hotel, restaurant and cafe) sectors as this opens a new area of business for them.

211.title: Tropical Storm Ma-on moves towards southeast China
211.article_body: Tropical Storm Ma-on gathered force and headed towards Hong Kong and other parts of southeast China on Wednesday. Cities in Guangdong province closed high-speed rail and ferry services, workers on sea projects were evacuated and several flights were cancelled. The Hong Kong Observatory warned winds with mean speeds of 63 km/h or more were expected.

212.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to air on TV from Sept 10: Reports
212.article_body: The new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS) will reportedly air from September 10. While Archana Puran Singh, Sumona Chakravarti, Kiku Sharda and Chandan Prabhakar will return to the show, Kapil will reportedly introduce new comic actors in the upcoming season. Kapil had recently started shooting for the show. The first episode might host Akshay Kumar.

213.title: Smartphone recovered from woman prisoner in Indore jail, guard suspended
213.article_body: A smartphone was recovered from a 35-year-old woman lodged as an undertrial in the district prison of Madhya Pradesh's Indore, an official said on Wednesday. Following the recovery, a female guard was suspended, the official added. The prisoner was brought to Indore from Tihar Jail as a cheating case is pending against her in a local court, jail's superintendent said.

214.title: Secure release of fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka: Stalin to Centre
214.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday urged the central government to intervene and ensure fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka are released. Stalin wrote to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar after 10 Indian fishermen were arrested and their boats seized on Monday for allegedly poaching in Lankan waters. Stalin said this was the fifth such incident since June this year.

215.title: Yamuna Expressway toll prices increased by up to ₹18.80 per km
215.article_body: Toll tariff on the Yamuna Expressway between Greater Noida and Agra has been increased between ₹2.60 and ₹18.80 per kilometre. Toll for car, jeep, van and light motor vehicles has been increased from ₹2.50 per kilometre to ₹2.65 per kilometre. It has been increased to ₹8.45 for bus or truck, while large size vehicles will be charged ₹18.80 per kilometre.

216.title: Lone JD(U) MLA in Arunachal Pradesh joins ruling BJP
216.article_body: Techi Kaso, the lone JD(U) legislator in Arunachal Pradesh, has joined the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). There are now 49 BJP MLAs in the 60-member state Assembly. This comes after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) broke alliance with BJP in Bihar. JD(U) had won seven seats in the 2019 state elections. However, six JD(U) MLAs joined BJP in 2020.

217.title: We'll continue protests till Raja Singh is arrested: AIMIM chief Owaisi
217.article_body: Condemning Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday demanded his arrest. "BJP and their MLA T Raja Singh issued a video expressing their hate against Prophet Muhammad," he said. "The Prophet lives in the hearts of Muslims...We will continue our protests till this MLA is arrested," he added.

218.title: Chile govt revives efforts to pass bill aimed to reduce working hours
218.article_body: The Chilean government said on Tuesday that it has revived efforts to pass legislation that would reduce weekly working hours. The bill, which aims to reduce the working week from 45 hours to 40 hours, was first introduced in the country's Congress in 2017. Lawmakers will debate a series of changes to the bill made by President Gabriel Boric's government.

219.title: Hyd court serves notice to BJP leaders in Kavitha's defamation case
219.article_body: A Hyderabad court served a notice to BJP leaders Parvesh Verma and Manjinder Sirsa in a defamation case filed by TRS MLC K Kavitha. Kavitha, who is Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao's daughter, was accused of being the middleman between the liquor mafia and the Delhi government. The court directed the BJP leaders to not make defamatory statements in the media.

220.title: Virat Kohli meets Babar Azam ahead of India-Pakistan match, pic goes viral
220.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli met Pakistan captain Babar Azam at the stadium, where both the teams are preparing for their Asia Cup 2022 encounter, which will take place on August 28. The picture of the duo went viral on social media, with a fan writing, "Picture of the day." "Babar and Virat broke the internet," wrote another.

221.title: The idea of 'Liger' came to me because of Allu Arjun: Puri Jagannadh
221.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh credited Allu Arjun for the idea behind 'Liger'. He said during the film 'Iddarammayilatho' (2013), Allu Arjun told him about a Hollywood director whose heroes always had some sort of disability. Puri said Arjun asked him to write such a character. "I suggested a hero who stammers and he liked it. That's how it started," he recalled.

222.title: Terrorism is 'crime against humanity': Rajnath Singh at SCO meet
222.article_body: Every form of terrorism, including cross-border terrorism, is a "crime against humanity", Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said at a Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meet in Tashkent on Wednesday. Singh added that Afghan territory must not be used for terror activities. The SCO member states are India, China, Russia, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and Pakistan.

223.title: BJP's Vijay Kumar Sinha named LoP in Bihar Assembly after resigning as Speaker
223.article_body: Senior BJP leader and former Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha was named as the Leader of the Opposition on Wednesday. Sinha resigned as the Speaker ahead of floor test on Wednesday morning. Earlier, the Leader of the Opposition was RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, who is now the Deputy Chief Minister of Bihar.

224.title: The single hardest thing in my life: Vijay on Tollywood debut
224.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said "probably the single hardest thing" in his life was to find a platform as an actor. Vijay said after finishing theatre, he thought of making his debut as a Tollywood actor but there was nowhere to go and "nobody was looking". He said he never lost hope and always believed he was meant for "something big".

225.title: UK PM Johnson meets Ukraine's Zelenskyy, announces military package
225.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv to mark Ukraine's Independence Day. Johnson announced a £54 million military support package to the country on the occasion, which will include 2,000 drones. "The UK will continue to stand with our Ukrainian friends. I believe Ukraine can and will win this war," Johnson said.

226.title: Latin America should be a major business hub for India: S Jaishankar
226.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has stressed on the importance of making Latin America a major business hub for India. Jaishankar, who is on a six-day official visit to Paraguay, Brazil and Argentina, interacted with prominent businessmen in Sao Paulo on Tuesday. "Business is the ballast that provides steady sailing for relationships," Jaishankar said in a tweet after the meeting.

227.title: Lingusamy pays ₹10,000 fine, avoids jail time in cheque fraud case: Reports
227.article_body: The Chennai Saidapet Court reportedly gave director Lingusamy an option to pay ₹10,000 fine or do six months jail time in the cheque fraud case. Reportedly, Lingusamy opted to pay the fine to avoid jail sentence. The case was filed against Lingusamy and his brother Subash Chandra Bose by a production company after their cheque of over ₹1 crore bounced.

228.title: Pak Army Colonel gave me ₹30,000 to attack Indian Army: Terrorist captured by India
228.article_body: Tabarak Hussain, a terrorist who was captured by Indian Army on August 21, said he was sent to India on a suicide mission by a Colonel of the Pakistan Army, adding that he was offered around ₹30,000 to target Indian Army. He was arrested along the LoC in the Jhangar sector of Naushera in Rajouri when he tried to infiltrate.

229.title: Rekha wasn't convinced to be on 'Koffee With Karan': Karan Johar
229.article_body: Director Karan Johar said he once approached actress Rekha to appear on 'Koffee With Karan', but she "wasn't convinced". He said he didn't push her about it as he thought the "exotic, beautiful mystery about her" has to be protected always. When asked about Aditya Chopra, Karan said, "I think I'm not brave enough to even ask him."

230.title: Belarus wishes us 'peaceful skies' but lets rockets hit us: Ukraine
230.article_body: Ukraine on Wednesday rejected Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko's "cynical" Independence Day greeting. Lukashenko wished Ukrainians "peaceful skies, tolerance...and success in restoring a decent life". "Lukashenko truly believes the world doesn't notice his participation in crimes against Ukraine...He...wishes us a 'peaceful sky' [but lets] rockets...hit us," a senior Ukrainian official said.

231.title: Gurugram mall raided by CBI not mine, BJP MP inaugurated it: Tejashwi
231.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday denied that the mall raided by the CBI in Gurugram is owned by him. Further, he claimed that a BJP MP had inaugurated the mall. He stated that upon inquiring about the 'Urban Cubes' mall and the company behind it, he found that a resident of Haryana named Krishna Kumar is its director.

232.title: India A squad for four-day matches against New Zealand A announced
232.article_body: The BCCI on Wednesday announced the India A squad for the four-day matches against New Zealand A. The team will be led by Priyank Panchal. Kuldeep Yadav, Prasidh Krishna and Ruturaj Gaikwad, who were part of India's squad for the recently concluded ODI series against Zimbabwe, have also been included in the team. The team also features Umran Malik.

233.title: Ex-world no. 1 Angelique Kerber announces pregnancy, to miss US Open
233.article_body: Former world number one Angelique Kerber took to social media to announce her pregnancy. "I really wanted to play the US Open...eventually I decided that two against one just isn't a fair competition," she wrote. "Being a professional athlete means everything to me but I'm grateful for the new path I'm heading to," she added.

234.title: 2-time Wimbledon champ Kvitova gets engaged to her coach, shares pic
234.article_body: Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova took to social media to announce that she has got engaged to her coach Jiri Vanek. Sharing a picture from the All England Lawn Tennis Club, Kvitova wrote, "Happy news we wanted to share with you guys... I said 'yes' in my special place." Kvitova began working with Vanek in November 2016.

235.title: RJD, JD(U) going to have a never-ending partnership: Tejashwi Yadav
235.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday said that RJD and JD(U) are going to have a never-ending partnership and will be working for the development of the state and the country. Calling RJD-JD(U) politicians as cricketers, he said, "No one is getting run out this time." "This is going to be the longest inning," Tejashwi added.

236.title: BJP is all publicity & no work: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
236.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday took a jibe at BJP during a special session at Assembly and said that the party is all publicity and no work. "You (BJP MLAs) are all running away. You will only get a position in your party if you say things against me," said Nitish as BJP MLAs staged a walkout.

237.title: 7 injured in reactor blast at pharma company in Telangana; 1 critical
237.article_body: Seven people were injured after a reactor blast took place at a pharmaceutical company in the Nalgonda district of Telangana on Wednesday. All the injured persons were taken to a nearby hospital where at least one of them is critical, Nalgonda Superintendent of Police Rema Rajeshwari said. A case will be registered, the police officer added.

238.title: There's 'mafia raj' in every department of Chhattisgarh govt: Tejasvi Surya
238.article_body: National President of BJP Yuva Morcha Tejasvi Surya on Wednesday alleged there is a 'mafia raj' in every department and every ministry of the Bhupesh Baghel government in Chhattisgarh. "In the history of Chhattisgarh, this is the largest movement against the corrupt and insensitive Bhupesh Baghel government," Surya said. "Your time is up Bhupesh Ji," Surya added.

239.title: EV battery startup Neuron Energy partners with e-Ashwa Automotive
239.article_body: Electric vehicle battery manufacturing startup Neuron Energy has announced a strategic partnership with EV maker e-Ashwa Automotive. Neuron Energy supplies lithium-ion and lead acid batteries in India, and under the partnership, e-Ashwa will purchase 600 battery packs per month and 10,000 battery packs annually. The deal closed at an estimated amount of ₹2 crore monthly and ₹30 crore per year.

240.title: Alteria Capital in talks to raise ₹3,500 cr for 3rd fund: Report
240.article_body: Venture debt firm Alteria Capital is looking to raise ₹3,500 crore from its investors, for its third debt fund, as per a report. Alteria's talks for its third fund come less than a year after it raised around ₹1,800 crore. Alteria aims to have a dual fund structure of which it will raise ₹2,000 crore for primary venture debt.

241.title: Told an actor my mom is a fan, he said 'teri maa ke saath main kya karunga': Actress
241.article_body: TV actress Kanishka Soni has revealed that a legendary actor once told her "tumhari maa ke saath main kya karunga?" after she informed him that her mother was a huge fan of him. Soni recently claimed that she married herself, saying, "The only person I am in love with is myself...I don't need any man ever."

242.title: Record 130 Indian-Americans at key positions in US President Biden's administration
242.article_body: US President Joe Biden has appointed more than 130 Indian-Americans to key positions in his administration so far, the best representation from the community that makes up over 1% of the American population. Biden's predecessor Donald Trump had appointed more than 80 Indian-Americans, and Barack Obama had appointed over 60 Indian-Americans to key positions during his eight years in office.

243.title: Japan considers building new nuclear power plants
243.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Wednesday said a new generation of nuclear power plants could be built, signalling a shift in policy after the 2011 tsunami which destroyed the Fukushima nuclear plant. The push for nuclear fuel comes as global energy supplies are under strain. Nuclear energy is expected to help Japan reach its carbon neutrality goal by 2050.

244.title: BJP should disclose its source of money being used to poach MLAs: AAP
244.article_body: AAP's political affairs committee condemned the BJP's efforts to "poach" its MLAs and asked the party to disclose from where it accumulated the money to poach other legislators, party spokesperson Sanjay Singh said on Wednesday. "We want to assure the people that the Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi is stable," Singh said.

245.title: Kejriwal calls special Assembly session on Aug 26 amid horse-trading claims
245.article_body: The Arvind Kejriwal-led Delhi government has called a special session of the Assembly on August 26 (Friday) over claims that BJP is trying to lure AAP MLAs. The Assembly session is scheduled to be held from 11 am. Earlier in the day, AAP MP Sanjay Singh claimed that BJP offered four AAP MLAs ₹20 crore each if they switched sides.

246.title: Researchers develop artificial leaves that produce clean fuel from sunlight
246.article_body: Researchers from the University of Cambridge have developed ultra-thin and flexible artificial leaves that generate clean fuels using sunlight and water. Inspired by the process of photosynthesis, these leaves can split water into hydrogen and oxygen or reduce carbon dioxide to syngas or synthetic gas, a mixture of carbon monoxide and hydrogen that can be used as fuel.

247.title: Journalist Siddique Kappan moves SC seeking bail in UAPA case
247.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan, booked under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA), has moved the Supreme Court seeking bail. "[He] has spent almost two years behind bars...only because he sought to discharge his professional duty of reporting on the infamous case of the Hathras rape and murder," the plea stated. It claimed that Kappan was arrested on the basis of "trumped-up charges".

248.title: BJP more brutal than British, undeclared Emergency since 2014: Patole
248.article_body: Maharashtra Congress president Nana Patole on Wednesday criticised the BJP, alleging that it was working in a "more brutal way" than the British rulers and claimed that India was under an undeclared Emergency since 2014. "BJP is misusing CBI, ED and Income Tax systems to gain political advantage. The party is restless after losing power in Bihar," he alleged.

249.title: Holistic healthcare a priority: PM at inauguration of cancer hospital
249.article_body: At the inauguration of the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in Mohali, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the Centre has been prioritising holistic healthcare since it came to power. PM Modi added that the healthcare of a country can be strengthened when hospitals provide solutions to problems. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann felicitated the PM at the inauguration.

250.title: Maha govt will make anti-conversion law more stringent: Fadnavis
250.article_body: After BJP MLA Nitesh Rane cited alleged religious conversion of Hindu women in Maharashtra, Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said the state government will make efforts to make the provisions of anti-conversion law stringent. "No one can carry out conversion with coercion," Fadnavis said. Rane alleged on the pretext of religious conversion, atrocities were committed against a minor in Ahmednagar.

251.title: The Swiss Alps have lost 50% of their glaciers in 80 years: Study
251.article_body: The Swiss Alps have lost nearly 50% of their glaciers in the last 80 years, a study has found. The scientists used images from the early 20th century to quantify how the climate crisis has impacted the mountains over the past eight decades. On average, the Alps have lost 0.73 cubic kilometres of ice per year, the researchers have found.

252.title: Constable asks man to deboard ladies' compartment in Chennai, stabbed
252.article_body: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) woman constable was stabbed by a man on a suburban train in Chennai on Tuesday after she asked him to deboard the compartment designated for female commuters. The man who stabbed the constable, identified as Asirva, on her neck then jumped from the train and fled. Asirva is currently undergoing treatment at a private hospital.

253.title: PM Modi to attend state funeral of ex-Japan PM Abe on Sept 27: Reports
253.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will attend the state funeral of ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe on September 27 in Tokyo, Japanese media has reported. PM Modi, who shared close ties with Abe, will then hold a meeting with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, reports have stated. Abe was shot dead by an assassin while delivering a speech in Nara city on July 8.

254.title: FDs are from my income, opened when I didn't even know Chandrashekar existed: Jacqueline
254.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez, who has been named as accused in a ₹200-crore extortion case, told authorities that her attached Fixed Deposits (FDs) were not created by using alleged proceeds of crime. She stated that the deposits are from her own legitimate income and were opened before she knew that the main accused Chandrashekar "even existed in the world".

255.title: Laxman named interim head coach for Asia Cup, Dravid to join after testing COVID -ve
255.article_body: VVS Laxman has been named India's interim head coach for Asia Cup, to be played in UAE. Laxman will oversee the team's preparation in the absence of regular head coach Rahul Dravid, who tested COVID-19 positive before the team's departure to UAE. Dravid will join the team once he tests negative and is cleared by the medical team, BCCI said.

256.title: Bangladeshi national lynched over suspicion of cattle theft in WB, 3 held
256.article_body: A Bangladeshi man was lynched in a village in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri on Wednesday after he was caught while allegedly trying to steal cows from a house, police said. Three people have been arrested in connection with the lynching. According to police, a gang of people from Bangladesh crossed the border with the intention of theft at Baruapara on Tuesday.

257.title: You can't run this far in your career without having abilities: Kohli on criticism
257.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli, who has been criticised over his poor form, said, "I know where my game stands." He added, "You cannot run this far in your international career without having...ability to counter situations and counter conditions and counter different kinds of bowling." Kohli stated, "When I come out of this phase...I know how consistent I can be."

258.title: American Express allowed to on-board new card customers in India as RBI lifts ban
258.article_body: American Express Banking Corp has been permitted to on-board new card customers in India as the RBI lifted the business restrictions. RBI had imposed the restrictions on American Express last year for non-compliance with the RBI circular dated April 6, 2018 on Storage of Payment System Data. The ban has now been lifted due to "satisfactory compliancy", the RBI said.

259.title: Dugongs functionally extinct in China: Study
259.article_body: A study published in the journal Royal Society Open Science has claimed that the Dugong, has gone functionally extinct in China. Researchers conducted several interviews in fishing communities across the country for the study. The Dugong, also known as the 'sea cow', is similar to the American manatee and can grow to about 3.4 metres in length.

260.title: James Cameron's 'Avatar' to re-release in theaters on Sept 23
260.article_body: Months before the release of 'Avatar: The Way of Water', the makers have announced the re-release of 2009 film 'Avatar'. The first part of the James Cameron's directorial franchise will return to the theatres on September 23. The makers announced the news on Wednesday with a new trailer of the Oscar-winning film.

261.title: IRCTC, Twitter officials to depose before Parliament panel on data security
261.article_body: A Parliamentary panel has called officials of Railways' catering arm IRCTC and social network company Twitter to depose before it on the handling of customer data. The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Information Technology will be chaired by Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Friday. This comes after IRCTC recently floated a tender to hire a consultant to monetise its passenger data.

262.title: Vijay joins Shah Rukh Khan on 'Jawan' sets, pic surfaces
262.article_body: Tamil actor Vijay has reportedly joined the sets of Shah Rukh Khan's 'Jawan' to shoot for his cameo appearance in the Atlee directorial. A picture, which has leaked from the sets, is going viral on the social media. It shows SRK and Vijay in a conversation with Atlee. As per reports, Vijay has not charged any money for his cameo.

263.title: NIA raids multiple locations in Delhi, other places in Mundra drug case
263.article_body: The NIA conducted multiple raids in Delhi and other cities in connection with its probe into the Mundra Port drug seizure case. Nearly 3,000 kg of heroin worth around ₹20,000 crore was seized in Gujarat's Mundra port last year. The raids were also conducted in multiple locations in Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Kolkata and Punjab.

264.title: CBI, ED & IT dept are BJP's 3 'jamais': Tejashwi Yadav on raids
264.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has called the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Income Tax Department (IT) three "jamais" (sons-in-law) of BJP. "When I go [abroad], BJP issues lookout notices...and when fraudsters like Nirav Modi run away, they do [nothing]," he said. CBI raided a property owned by Yadav in connection with a 'land-for-job' scam today.

265.title: Hyd Police auction 1,150 seized, abandoned vehicles; fetch ₹64 lakh
265.article_body: Hyderabad City Police auctioned 1,150 seized and abandoned vehicles on Tuesday, which brought in ₹64,63,200. Of the 1,150 vehicles up for auction, 1,060 abandoned scrap vehicles fetched ₹53,05,000. Around 82 roadworthy vehicles were auctioned for ₹11,58,200 in the auction. The vehicles were auctioned after their registered owners failed to claim them despite being notified via press releases.

266.title: Fire truck not deployed after tree fell in Pune college; probe on
266.article_body: Pune fire brigade department has initiated an inquiry into the incident where a fire officer from Janta Vasahat Fire Station reached Pune's SP College on a bike after a 30-foot-tall tree fell on the campus on Monday. "[He] did not send a fire brigade vehicle," a department official said. A 49-year-old gardener died after being injured during the incident.

267.title: China changes ending of latest 'Minions' movie
267.article_body: Censors in China have changed the ending of the latest 'Minions' movie, 'Minions: The Rise of Gru'. In the international version, Gru and Wild Knuckles, the movies' two thief anti-heroes, escape punishment after Knuckles fakes his own death. However, the version shown to Chinese viewers includes a note stating that Wild Knuckles was arrested and served 20 years in jail.

268.title: Proud to hear TN govt schemes appreciated by President & VP: Stalin
268.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday said he was proud to hear President Droupadi Murmu and Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar appreciating the schemes being implemented in Tamil Nadu and the state's overall progress. Various states are trying to copy the development schemes of the DMK government, but some political parties in the state were criticising the regime, Stalin said.

269.title: Complaint filed against 'Laal...', 'Shabaash Mithu' for 'ridiculing' disability community
269.article_body: Dr Satendra Singh, Co-founder of Doctors with Disabilities, has filed a complaint against 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Shabaash Mithu' for "ridiculing and mocking" the entire disability community. The complaint was filed with the Court of Chief Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities. As per Satendra, the court has issued a notice to the makers of the two films on his complaint.

270.title: Who is Natalia, the Ukrainian woman accused of blowing up Russian nationalist's daughter?
270.article_body: Ukrainian woman Natalia Vovk who has been accused of blowing up a Russian nationalist's daughter is a veteran of Mariupol's Azov Battalion turned spy, according to Russia's FSB. Natalia spent weeks tracking Darya Dugina before planting explosives under driver's seat of her car. Natalia arrived in Russia on July 23, together with her daughter Sofya Shaban, according to FSB.

271.title: India's Shubman Gill jumps 93 spots in latest ODI rankings
271.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings, with India's Shubman Gill jumping 93 spots in the rankings for ODI batters. The 22-year-old is now ranked 38th after finishing as the leading run-scorer in the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe with 245 runs. Virat Kohli, who is ranked fifth, remains the top-ranked Indian ODI batter, followed by Rohit Sharma (sixth).

272.title: Huge sunspot on Sun's surface grows 10 times in size in 48 hours, pic surfaces
272.article_body: A huge sunspot on the Sun's surface has grown 10 times in size in the last 48 hours. The sunspot, called AR3085, is also shooting off several minor solar flares. Sunspots are areas that appear dark on the surface of the Sun. They appear dark because they are cooler than other parts of the Sun's surface, as per NASA.

273.title: South Korea breaks its own record for world's lowest fertility rate
273.article_body: South Korea has broken its own record for the world's lowest fertility rate. Korean women were estimated, based on 2021 data, to have an average of just 0.81 children over their lifetimes, down from 0.84 a year earlier. South Korea's population will fall by 53% to 24 million by 2100, as per an analysis.

274.title: Lalu Yadav acquitted in 2015 poll code violation case
274.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav was acquitted by the civil court in Bihar's Hajipur on Wednesday in the 2015 poll code violation case on grounds of lack of evidence. Yadav was accused of making casteist remarks during a campaign supporting his son Tejashwi. He had allegedly called the Assembly election a direct fight between "the backward castes and forward castes".

275.title: 95 kg sandalwood worth ₹3.91 lakh seized by Pune Police; 5 arrested
275.article_body: Pune Police seized 95 kg of sandalwood worth ₹3.91 lakh on Tuesday and arrested five people from Sinhagad road area. Crime branch officials had reportedly laid a trap for the culprits at PL Deshpande Garden. "This gang targeted sandalwood trees on [the] premises of National Defence Academy, Film and Television Institute of India and other government offices," police said.

276.title: 3 killed, 2 injured after car falls into ditch in UP's Jaunpur
276.article_body: Police on Wednesday said three people were killed and two others were injured when their car lost balance, overturned and fell into a ditch in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur. The accident occurred on Tuesday night when they were returning after attending a wedding. Police said 29-year-old Shaklain and 23-year-old Sarvjeet died on the spot and 25-year-old Ayush Srivastava succumbed to injuries.

277.title: Prabhas' action-thriller with director Maruthi to go on floors in November
277.article_body: Director Maruthi has confirmed that his upcoming supernatural action-thriller with Prabhas will go on floors in November. "He (Prabhas) is doing two-three projects and is very busy. So, according to his dates and comfort, we have to start," he said. Maruthi said the Prabhas starrer is a big film, which will be shot entirely in India.

278.title: Policeman bludgeons 8-month-pregnant wife to death in J&K's Kathua
278.article_body: A Special Police Officer (SPO) allegedly bludgeoned his eight-month-pregnant wife to death on Tuesday in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. According to police, the accused, who was on leave for the past three days, brutally murdered his wife following an argument over a domestic issue and fled the spot. Angry villagers also reportedly set his house on fire.

279.title: Hong Kong court refuses to recognise overseas same-sex marriages
279.article_body: A Hong Kong court has rejected an appeal to recognise same-sex marriages of those people who've legally wed overseas. Offering such recognition would "create an inherent incompatibility" between them and gay couples who cannot legally marry in Hong Kong, the judges ruled. The appeal was lodged by an LGBTQ and pro-democracy activist who married his partner in US in 2013.

280.title: Kejriwal calls meeting of AAP MLAs tomorrow amid ED & CBI raids on party leaders
280.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has called a meeting of all AAP MLAs at his residence at 11am on Thursday regarding the discussion on the current political scenario and ED and CBI raids on AAP leaders. AAP has alleged that BJP is attempting to overthrow the Delhi government. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has claimed some MLAs were threatened to break AAP.

281.title: Exploded with love and joy: Karan on Bipasha Basu's pregnancy
281.article_body: Karan Singh Grover said his body "exploded with love and joy" when he got to know about his wife Bipasha Basu's pregnancy. Karan said he feels gratitude to be witnessing Bipasha "creating a life within her and making it look like it's all just a part of her day". Earlier, Karan described the child as a "creation manifested by love".

282.title: AIMIM demands Raja Singh's ouster from T'gana Assembly over Prophet row
282.article_body: The AIMIM on Wednesday wrote a letter to the Telangana Legislative Assembly's Speaker, demanding the expulsion of Goshamahal MLA Raja Singh over his alleged objectionable remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "Raja Singh has repeatedly conducted himself in a manner that is unbecoming of a member of the house," the letter read. Singh's comments have hurt Muslims across India, it further read.

283.title: Servify raises $65 million in Series D round, aims for IPO in 2 years
283.article_body: Servify, a platform that manages after-sales experience for smartphone vendors such as Apple and Samsung, has raised $65 million in its Series D funding round. The round was led by Singularity Growth Opportunity Fund. Founder Sreevathsa Prabhakar said that they were closing in on a $1-billion valuation and are aiming to go public in about 18 to 24 months.

284.title: IIT alumni-founded Loopworm raises $3.4 mn in seed funding round
284.article_body: Agri-biotechnology firm Loopworm has raised $3.4 million in an early-stage seed funding round. The round was led by Omnivore and WaterBridge Ventures and saw participation from Titan Capital and other angel investors. Founded in 2019 by IIT Roorkee graduates Ankit Alok Bagaria and Abhi Gawri, Loopworm upcycles food waste into protein-rich nutrients and value-added ingredients using insect farming.

285.title: Congress' official YouTube channel deleted
285.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday tweeted, "Our YouTube channel - 'Indian National Congress' has been deleted. We are fixing it and have been in touch with Google/YouTube teams." "We are investigating what caused this - a technical glitch or sabotage. Hope to be back soon," the party added.

286.title: Maha BJP MLA Rane demands anti-conversion law to protect Hindu women
286.article_body: BJP MLA Nitish Rane has demanded an anti-conversion law in Maharashtra, citing the alleged religious conversion of Hindu women. Rane said that Hindu women who marry Muslim men are kidnapped and sold, adding that people who engage in such unlawful activities are compensated financially. Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has assured that the anti-conversion bill will be introduced, Rane added.

287.title: Being forced to pay 50% commission for projects: BBMP contractors
287.article_body: Contractors working on projects of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) have alleged they are being forced to pay 50% commission for getting approvals to complete the projects. In a letter to BBMP chief Tushar Girinath, BBMP Working Contractors Association said commissions are being demanded in all municipal offices. Contractors were not paid in the last 22 months, the letter added.

288.title: Delhi's Springdales School gets included in World Book of Records
288.article_body: New Delhi's Springdales School has been felicitated with the Certificate of Excellence by the World Book of Records, said Barrister Santosh Shukla, President and CEO, World Book of Records. The school organised a mass event, in which 800 students did a round of 11 Surya Namaskars sitting on a chair.

289.title: MP man cuts his vein, climbs on tower after wife refuses to return home
289.article_body: A man from Madhya Pradesh first cut his vein and then climbed on top of a tower after his wife refused to return from her maternal home. In a video that has now gone viral on the internet, the man can be seen sitting in the middle of the tower and asking the police to get his wife back.

290.title: Move to stifle media: Congress on Adani's NDTV takeover bid
290.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said the Adani Group's bid to acquire a controlling stake in media company NDTV could "stifle any semblance of an independent media". Adani Group's AMG Media has acquired 29.18% stake in NDTV and will launch an offer for another 26%. Ramesh alluded to billionaire Gautam Adani as PM Narendra Modi's "khaas dost" (special friend).

291.title: B'luru-based company launches API to alert users of severe weather events
291.article_body: A Bengaluru-based climate-intelligence company, Ambee, on Wednesday launched a new API to alert users of severe weather events such as hurricanes, storms and heatwaves, among others. "It is critical to consider the causes of these events, as well as their relationship to climate change and how various environmental factors interact with one another," a statement from Ambee read.

292.title: Link road in east Bengaluru to be closed from Aug 25 for rail works
292.article_body: A link road in east Bengaluru from Frazer Town (Pulakeshinagar) to Richards Town traversing the rail lines between Bengaluru Cantonment and Bengaluru East stations will be closed from Thursday (August 25). The road is expected to be closed for a few months to facilitate the quadrupling of the railway line. All types of vehicle movements are being restricted, police said.

293.title: Video shows UP lineman cutting power to police station after being fined
293.article_body: A traffic policeman reportedly issued a challan of ₹6,000 to a contractual lineman of Electricity Department in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli. Upset with this, he, along with other employees, allegedly cut off the electricity supply to the police station, citing high outstanding bills. A video of the incident showing a lineman climbing a pole to disconnect the supply went viral online.

294.title: Hyderabad may get 'Wind Garden' to lower temperatures and cool city
294.article_body: Hyderabad may soon get a 'Wind Garden' similar to the one in Madrid, Spain. Tagging a tweet by Madrid administration on Twitter, Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister K T Rama Rao said, "Let's try this in Hyderabad @arvindkumar_ias, Get details and explore our HMDA urban parks for this." A Wind Garden can help lower temperatures in the city.

295.title: Stop work on Aarey forest until next hearing: SC tells Mumbai Metro
295.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday directed Mumbai Metro to not carry out any work on Aarey forest until the next hearing. "The counsel for MMRCL submits that her clients have already filed an affidavit that no trees have been or would be cut in any manner," a three-judge bench said. The counsel for Maharashtra government has sought time to collate documents.

296.title: UK will be a lifelong friend to Ukraine: Sunak on Ukraine's I-Day
296.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak wrote a letter on Ukraine's Independence Day, August 24, praising the country's "steadfast courage", adding that UK will remain a "lifelong friend" to Ukraine. "We'll prioritise building cultural...and business links between our...nations to help [Ukraine] thrive as an independent country," he wrote. Notably, August 24 also marks six months since Russia invaded Ukraine.

297.title: Cottonmouth snake eats python at US zoo; pic of X-ray goes viral
297.article_body: The Zoo Miami in US posted a picture of an X-ray showing a python inside a cottonmouth snake. "You can see the spine and the transmitter of the python inside of the cottonmouth on this X-ray, or radiograph, that was taken at Zoo Miami's animal hospital," the zoo wrote along with the viral picture.

298.title: Outgoing Bihar Speaker did not want a Dalit to preside over House: Dy Speaker
298.article_body: Outgoing Bihar Assembly Speaker VK Sinha nominated JD(U) leader Narendra Narayan Yadav to chair the post-lunch Assembly session after resigning on Wednesday. State Deputy Speaker Maheshwar Hazari said, "It appears that [Sinha] did not want a Dalit to preside over the House…By denying me the opportunity, he…insulted Dalits." However, Yadav later announced that Hazari shall preside over the session.

299.title: Mumbai court denies bail to man who raped 80-yr-old paralysed woman
299.article_body: A Mumbai court has denied bail to a 26-year-old man who was arrested for raping an 80-year-old paralysed woman in 2020. The victim's daughter-in-law, who's the informant in the case, had 'settled' the matter outside the court and hence the accused should be considered for bail, his lawyer had argued. The court, however, noted that such a settlement is "irrelevant".

300.title: Gill's performances are putting 'pressure' on Shikhar Dhawan: Styris
300.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said Shubman Gill's performances in ODI cricket are putting "pressure" on Shikhar Dhawan. "There aren't too many top-order left-handers who are taking the game by the scruff of the neck in Indian cricket as an opener, and...Dhawan has that going in his favour," added Styris. Gill was the leading run-scorer in the ODIs against Zimbabwe.

301.title: It 'isn't right' to compare Kohli and Babar Azam: Rajkumar Sharma
301.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said it is not right to compare Kohli and Pakistan captain Babar Azam currently, as the former has played a lot more cricket. "Even in T20Is, the difference is 25 matches which takes almost two years to cover," added Rajkumar. Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram earlier stated that it is too early to compare them.

302.title: Edtech firm BrightCHAMPS acquires Singapore-based Schola for $15 mn
302.article_body: Edtech firm BrightCHAMPS has announced the acquisition of Singapore-based company Schola in a $15 million cash and stock deal. In June 2022, the startup backed by entrepreneur Binny Bansal announced that it had allocated $100 million to make edtech acquisitions across the US, UK, Southeast Asia, North Africa and the Middle East. BrightCHAMPS earlier acquired edtech startup Education10x.

303.title: Gang looting app cab drivers at knifepoint busted in Mumbai, 4 held
303.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested four members of a gang allegedly involved in robbing app cab drivers at knifepoint by taking them to isolated streets. Police said they formed a team after a victim, Aziz Ansari, filed a complaint on Monday claiming he was robbed at knifepoint. The team laid a trap in Shivaji Nagar and arrested the accused.

304.title: Sri Lanka bans import of chocolates, perfumes amid economic crisis
304.article_body: Sri Lanka's finance ministry has banned the import of 300 consumer items including chocolates, perfumes, shampoos and makeup products. The decision comes as Sri Lanka continues to face its worst economic crisis since independence in 1948. According to the regulation, items which were shipped before August 23 and arrive before September 14 would be allowed.

305.title: TMC's Anubrata sent to 14-day judicial custody in cattle smuggling case
305.article_body: The CBI Special Court on Wednesday sent TMC's Birbhum district chief Anubrata Mondal to 14-day judicial custody in connection with the 2020 cattle smuggling case. Earlier, the court had sent Mondal to CBI custody till August 20. He was arrested from his residence in Bolpur on August 11 after he failed to appear for questioning twice in three days.

306.title: Residents can apply for municipal swimming pool membership online: BMC
306.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has said Mumbai residents can apply for membership for municipal swimming pools online. As part of the first phase, annual membership will be given to 6,000 Mumbaikars for four swimming pools. "The decision...was taken considering...busy lives of Mumbaikars that make it difficult to visit the swimming pools for filling of forms in person," BMC stated.

307.title: No mercy for killers of Russian nationalist Dugin's daughter: Lavrov
307.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Tuesday there can be "no mercy" for those behind a car bombing that killed Darya Dugina, the daughter of pro-Kremlin nationalist and President Vladimir Putin's aide Alexander Dugin. "The investigation will...be completed soon," Lavrov said. It is speculated that Alexander Dugin, who's known as 'Putin's brain', was the intended target of the attack.

308.title: CM Nitish Kumar-led 'Mahagathbandhan' govt proves majority in Bihar as BJP MLAs walk out
308.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led  'Mahagathbandhan' government on Wednesday proved its majority as BJP MLAs walked out of the Assembly. Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said, "We're cricketers and this pair (RJD and JDU) is going to have a never-ending partnership." Earlier this month, CM Kumar ended his government's alliance with BJP and joined hands with RJD and other 'Mahagathbandhan' parties.

309.title: I'm not going to give up: Mayank Agarwal on his international future
309.article_body: Indian batter Mayank Agarwal has said he has not given up on his future in international cricket. "I'm going to keep chasing it and improve my game with each passing day," he added. Mayank is the highest run-scorer in the ongoing Maharaja T20 Trophy and has scored two centuries in the tournament so far.

310.title: Police bust fake educational certificates racket in Hyderabad, 6 held
310.article_body: The Rachakonda Police on Tuesday busted a fake educational certificates racket and arrested six persons in connection with the case. "So far, the gang supplied educational certificates and Letter of Recommendation to around 500 persons," Police Commissioner said. Efforts are on to arrest another accused, who is currently absconding, police added.

311.title: Commerce Dept revamp to achieve $2 trillion exports by 2030: Goyal
311.article_body: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Tuesday released a transformative plan for the Commerce Department with a focus on a dedicated trade promotion body and digitisation of trade facilitation processes, among others. The aim is to make the Indian Trade Service "future ready" and help achieve the $2-trillion export target by 2030, Goyal said.

312.title: Privacy complaint filed against Google over unsolicited ad emails
312.article_body: By sending unsolicited advertising emails directly to the inbox of Gmail users, Google has breached a European Union court ruling, Austrian advocacy group noyb.eu (None Of Your Business) said on Wednesday. The group filed a complaint with the French data protection authority, CNIL, saying that Google should seek prior permission from Gmail users before sending them any direct marketing emails.

313.title: Apple confirms delaying release of iPadOS 16
313.article_body: Apple has delayed the release of iPadOS 16 and it will be rolled out as version 16.1 in a free software update. Reports have it that the new multitasking system built into the iPadOS 16 needs more time to get fixed. While the iOS is expected to be rolled out in September, the new OS could get an October release.

314.title: AAP trying to deflect BJP's questions on malpractices in excise policy: Sambit Patra
314.article_body: Alleging that AAP is trying to deflect BJP's questions on malpractices in the implementation of the excise policy, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said the Delhi government ignored the advice of the expert panel to gain "an unfair advantage in Punjab polls". AAP handed over wholesale liquor business to private players despite the expert panel recommending against it, he added.

315.title: Model who posed topless while kissing female friend at Finland PM's home posts apology
315.article_body: The model who posed topless while kissing her female friend in Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin's official residence has apologised in a post on Instagram. Sabina Särkkä wrote, "I published an inappropriate picture that should not have been taken. I am deeply sorry and apologise for my behaviour." Earlier, Marin apologised for the picture.

316.title: BJP will be finished in 5 yrs, downfall started from Bihar: AIUDF MLA
316.article_body: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) chief Karim Uddin Barbhuiya stated on Wednesday that Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) will be finished in five-six years. BJP's downfall has started from Bihar, the Assam MLA added. This comes after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar broke ties with BJP. Barbhuiya further claimed that many Congress leaders will join AIUDF on September 2 in Barpeta.

317.title: Ex-Hyderabad Mayor Bonthu Rammohan booked in cheating case
317.article_body: Police on Tuesday booked former Hyderabad Mayor Bonthu Rammohan under sections of the SC/ST Atrocities Act as well for cheating and attempted extortion. According to the police, the complainant Bommaku Murali alleged that Rammohan used his political clout to cheat him out of a land transaction worth about ₹4 crore and also abused him in the name of caste.

318.title: Jaiveer Shergill quits Congress, says 'I've been seeking time from Gandhis for a year'
318.article_body: Congress national spokesperson Jaiveer Shergill on Wednesday said he has resigned from all party posts. He said, "I've been seeking time from Rahul Gandhi, Sonia Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for more than a year, but we are not welcomed in the office." He added, "The decision-making of the Congress party is not in sync with the ground reality anymore."

319.title: Milind Soman meets PM Modi, gifts him Krishna idol from Vrindavan
319.article_body: Actor Milind Soman met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi. Taking to Instagram, he shared pictures of the meeting. "I thanked him for all he is doing to encourage people to take up yoga and Ayurveda across the country," Milind captioned the post. "Gifted him a Balakrishna that Ankita Konwar brought from Vrindavan during Janmashtami," he added.

320.title: Biggest challenge for Rohit is players who haven't played regularly: Bangar
320.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said the "biggest challenge" for India captain Rohit Sharma in the upcoming Asia Cup is the players who've not played regularly. "It could be fitness or like Virat Kohli took a break, [who's] also making a comeback. KL Rahul had gotten injured," stated Bangar. India will begin their campaign against Pakistan on August 28.

321.title: Users complain of random celebrity posts on Facebook feed, company says 'error fixed'
321.article_body: Several users on Wednesday complained of facing a glitch on Facebook wherein their feeds showed random celebrity posts. These posts were taking over users’ main feed and suppressing the usual stream of images and videos shared by their friends. Meanwhile, a Facebook spokesperson said the bug was caused by a configuration change and the company has now fixed the error.

322.title: Govt, LIC consider selling 51% stake of IDBI Bank: Reports
322.article_body: The central government and the Life Insurance Corporation (LIC), who together own about 94% of IDBI Bank's shares, are considering selling at least 51% of the bank's stake, according to reports. At the existing market capitalisation, 51% stake in IDBI Bank amounts to ₹22,017 crore. The government is also likely to keep some shares of the bank after the sale.

323.title: Bawled throughout: Kevin Smith on Ben Affleck & Jennifer’s wedding
323.article_body: Ben Affleck's close friend Kevin Smith opened up about the actor's second wedding ceremony with Jennifer Lopez at his Georgia property. Kevin said the ceremony was "one of the most beautiful events" he has ever been a part of. He said, "I bawled throughout because it was so goddamn beautiful." Ben and Jennifer's second wedding took place on August 20.

324.title: The winner of India-Pak match will win the Asia Cup: Shane Watson
324.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said Pakistan are "high on confidence" ahead of the Asia Cup match against India on August 28, having defeated the latter by 10 wickets in T20 World Cup 2021. "When their confidence is high, they're nearly unstoppable," added Watson. "Whoever wins that game is going to go on and win the Asia Cup," he stated.

325.title: Felicitating Bilkis Bano convicts was in ‘absolute bad taste’: Retd Judge
325.article_body: Felicitation of the convicts in the Bilkis Bano case by some people was in "absolute bad taste", said retired judge UD Salvi, the judge who convicted the accused 14 years ago. "The state has the right to grant remission. It's a power given to the state under law," Salvi said, adding that he did nothing special in convicting them.

326.title: TMC removes Tripura unit chief Subal Bhowmik ahead of Assembly polls
326.article_body: The TMC on Wednesday removed its Tripura chief Subal Bhowmik ahead of the 2023 Assembly elections. TMC announced that former West Bengal minister Rajib Banerjee and Rajya Sabha MP Sushmita Dev will look after party operations till the new president is appointed. While the reason behind the move is unknown, reports suggested that Bhowmik might soon join BJP or Congress.

327.title: No evidence of Indian companies evading sanctions imposed on Russia: US
327.article_body: US Deputy Secretary of Treasury Wally Adeyemo on Wednesday said there is "no evidence of Indian companies circumventing the sanctions imposed on Russia" following the invasion of Ukraine. He further said that companies around the world, including those in India, the US and Europe, are taking the sanctions seriously and implementing them as well.

328.title: Cab drivers in B'luru working more at night to skip traffic: Report
328.article_body: Cab drivers in Bengaluru have begun working longer during night to avoid peak traffic hours amid rise in fuel costs, said reports. Cabbies are struggling to pay commission demanded by apps, the reports added. "Traffic in Bengaluru has taken a mental toll on them. There is no choice but to find alternative model," Karnataka Ola Uber drivers' association president said.

329.title: Was 'very scared' of women till 18, couldn't look them in the eye: Vijay
329.article_body: 'Arjun Reddy' actor Vijay Deverakonda said he was "extremely scared" of women till he turned 18. "I didn't have the balls to look a woman in the eye...I thought women were...a different species," added Vijay. Elaborating on his life while growing up, Vijay stated his father taught him that "love is bullshit" and he'll get love "if he has money".

330.title: Sonali wasn't the way she was portrayed in 'Bigg Boss': Vikas Gupta
330.article_body: Producer Vikas Gupta said he was "shocked" to learn about the death of BJP leader and actress Sonali Phogat. He said Sonali, who passed away on Monday, was nothing like how she was portrayed in 'Bigg Boss 14'. He said, in real life, she was positive, confident and health conscious. He called her an epitome of grace, warmth and kindness.

331.title: BJP, be careful: Manish Sisodia on claim of ₹20 cr offered to AAP MLAs
331.article_body: Soon after AAP MP Sanjay Singh claimed that BJP offered four party MLAs ₹20 crore each if they switched sides, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted, "BJP, be careful." He added, "These are Arvind Kejriwal's soldiers, followers of Bhagat Singh. They will sacrifice their lives but will never betray. CBI and ED are of no use in front of them."

332.title: Congress needs to come out of factionalism & stay united: Anand Sharma
332.article_body: Anand Sharma, who had resigned as the Chairman of Congress' Steering Committee for Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, on Wednesday said Congress collectively has to revive. "Congress needs to come out of factionalism and stay united…What's important is that the Congress party stays strong," Sharma added. "I will campaign for Congress party wherever it is required," he stated.

333.title: Nigeria introduces Bharat Biotech's ROTAVAC to vaccinate children
333.article_body: Nigeria has introduced Bharat Biotech International Limited's (BBIL) rotavirus oral vaccine ROTAVAC to immunise its children against the diarrhoeal disease. About 50,000 children under the age of five years die every year in Nigeria due to rotavirus infection. Rotavirus accounts for about 2,15,000 out of 5,25,000-under-five mortality worldwide each year attributed to diarrhoeal diseases.

334.title: PM inaugurates Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in Punjab's Mohali
334.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in Punjab's Mohali. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was also present at the event. The hospital, built at a cost of over ₹660 crore by Tata Memorial Centre, is a 300-bed facility. "Holistic healthcare...placed among the top priorities in India in the last eight years," PM said.

335.title: Stolen car found stuck in metro station in Spain; video surfaces
335.article_body: A video shows a stolen car stuck in a metro station in Spain's Madrid being removed by firefighters. Police said they are investigating after the vehicle was found next to a staircase in Plaza Eliptica station. Police officials further said that the driver was taken to hospital to be checked, adding that no one was injured.

336.title: Why can't Centre call all-party meet for discussion?: SC on freebies
336.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday, while hearing matter of promising freebies before elections, asked why can’t Centre call an all-party meeting to discuss the matter. "Why does not the Government of India form a committee to study this issue?" the bench led by CJI NV Ramana asked. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta replied that the Centre will help in every way.

337.title: Police shut down petrol pumps in Hyderabad Old City amid protests
337.article_body: The Hyderabad Police closed down petrol pumps across parts of the Old City as protests continue against the now suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh for his alleged controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The Charminar is kept open for visitors for now, but will be closed in the case of any major protest or skirmishes, the Archaeological Survey of India said.

338.title: 2 killed, 3 injured in ambulance-motorcycle collision in Madhya Pradesh
338.article_body: At least two persons were killed and three others were injured when a motorcycle collided with an ambulance in Madhya Pradesh near the Thuna Pachama village on Bhopal-Indore Road, police said. The accident took place five kilometres from the district headquarters, City Superintendent of Police Niranjan Rajput added. Both the deceased were on the motorcycle and died on the spot.

339.title: Our sweetest megastar: 'Liger' actor Vijay Deverakonda on Chiranjeevi
339.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda took to Twitter and called actor Chiranjeevi the "sweetest megastar". "Chiru sirrrr...really hope you enjoy ['Liger'] and we make you proud," he added. This comes after Chiranjeevi took to Twitter and wished Vijay, director Puri Jagannadh and the 'Liger' team ahead of the film's release. Chiranjeevi also posted a picture alongside Vijay.

340.title: We won't be scared: Rabri Devi after CBI raids on RJD leaders
340.article_body: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi criticised BJP over CBI raid at the residences of RJD leaders in connection with the 'land for jobs scam' and said that BJP is scared of the newly formed government in Bihar. "All parties are with us except BJP. We have the majority here in the state and we will not be scared," she added.

341.title: BMC to fine Ganesh mandals ₹2000 for each pit made while erecting pandals
341.article_body: If erecting Ganesh pandals cause any potholes on roads, the organisers of the mandals will be fined ₹2000 for each one of it, BMC said. The civic body has set up a team to check if the roads are damaged while setting up the pandals. The Ganesh mandals, however, said they've taken maximum measures to ensure no road is damaged.

342.title: I don't understand box office at all: Mona Singh on 'Laal Singh...'
342.article_body: Speaking about the box office collection of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Mona Singh said, "I'm not a filmy person...don't understand box office at all." She further stated she is satisfied that people have good things to say about the film. "I don't want to think about the short-term things like how much money it made, that's beyond me," she added.

343.title: Never had knee injury as pacer: Akram on criticism over Shaheen's 'workload'
343.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has reacted to PCB's criticism over Shaheen Afridi's injury, due to which the pacer has been ruled out of Asia Cup. "The think-tank has been criticised for not managing Shaheen's workload. But he's [22], he has to play cricket. He suffered a knee injury. I never had knee injury as a fast bowler," stated Akram.

344.title: Mumbai man who fell from Dahi Handi pyramid dies; organiser arrested
344.article_body: A 24-year-old man named Sandesh Dalvi succumbed to his injuries on Monday after falling from a Dahi Handi pyramid in Mumbai. The event's organiser, Riyaz Shaikh, was arrested on Tuesday on charges of causing death due to negligence. He was later granted bail. "The safety measures given by the government, which include providing helmets [and] safety nets...weren't followed," police said.

345.title: Patients getting 'fake calls' from us asking for money: Pune hospitals
345.article_body: Officials from Pune's Sassoon General Hospital (SGH) and other private hospitals have reported incidents wherein patients' families have allegedly received fake calls from 'hospital staffers' asking for money. The caller allegedly asked patients to send money to the bank account of a rickshaw driver, an official from SGH said. A complaint has also been filed on the behalf of SGH.

346.title: Video of 9-yr-old boy urinating in Mumbai society shared online; 2 booked
346.article_body: The secretary and a member of a housing society in Mumbai have been booked for allegedly sharing a video of a nine-year-old boy urinating on the staircase of the society building. The accused, booked under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, had allegedly recovered CCTV footage of the child and had shared it on a WhatsApp group for residents.

347.title: 20-yr-old prisoner dies after fight with inmate inside Delhi's Tihar jail
347.article_body: A 20-year-old (Samir Khan) prisoner in Delhi's Tihar jail died after a fight with a fellow inmate in the barrack on Monday morning, officials said on Wednesday. "The whole incident is captured on CCTV cameras. Samir had no visible injuries. He was declared brought dead at the hospital," an officer said.
