Jail guards will be questioned for negligence, police said.

348.title: Sonali's death was a pre-planned murder, we doubt her personal assistant: Brother
348.article_body: Late BJP leader Sonali Phogat's brother Rinku on Wednesday said that her death was a "pre-planned murder". He said, "We've doubts on two people including her personal assistant. I demand a CBI investigation into her death." He added, "We are not satisfied with the postmortem done here in Goa. We want that it should be done again at AIIMS, Delhi."

349.title: ED recovers 2 AK-47 assault rifles from home of Jharkhand CM Soren's 'close aide'
349.article_body: The ED on Wednesday recovered two AK-47 assault rifles from the residence of middleman Prem Prakash in connection with an illegal mining and extortion case. Prakash is reportedly a close aide of Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren. The ED raided multiple locations in Ranchi today as part of its ongoing money laundering investigation into alleged illegal mining in the state.

350.title: Nothing compared to today: Mandakini on breastfeeding scene in 'Ram...'
350.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini said her breastfeeding scene in the film is "nothing" in comparison to the skin show in today's times. "[The scene] was also...pure...Nowadays, it is all about sexuality," added Mandakini. "It was [actually] not a breastfeeding scene, it was shot in such a way that it could look like one," stated the actress.

351.title: Meta reaches $37.5 mn settlement in location tracking lawsuit
351.article_body: Meta reached a $37.5 million settlement in a lawsuit that accused the firm of violating users' privacy by tracking their movements without permission. Facebook allegedly violated its own privacy policy and a California law by accessing the data of users who had turned off location services. The settlement covers people in the US who used Facebook after January 30, 2015.

352.title: Children born in civic hospitals to soon be screened for deafness: BMC
352.article_body: BMC has decided to test every child born in Mumbai civic hospitals for deafness and will soon appoint an agency for the screenings. "BMC will start (screening) in its 47 hospitals and maternity homes including KEM, Nair and Sion hospitals and Wadia...a private hospital," an official said. "Within six months, the child will get a hearing aid," another official added.

353.title: Australian church asks staff to not use Uber over ethical concerns
353.article_body: The Uniting Church in Australia's Victoria and Tasmania Synod ordered its staff to not use Uber and Uber Eats citing concerns over the treatment of drivers and delivery riders. It said that many Uber staff earned below the minimum wage and worked excessive hours as they were independent contractors. Uber said it was "committed to improving standards for independent contractors".

354.title: Ranbir apologises over comment on Alia's pregnancy weight gain; video surfaces
354.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor has apologised for his comment on wife Alia Bhatt's pregnancy weight gain. "Well, I can see somebody has phailoed (spread out)," he had said. "It's a joke that didn't turn out to be funny. It wasn't my intention. I spoke to Alia...and she laughed it off...I apologise to those who got offended by it," he said.

355.title: 29-yr-old Indian-American hiker, who was swept away in a flash flood, found dead
355.article_body: A 29-year-old Indian-American female hiker, who got swept away in a flash flood last week at the Zion National Park in US' Utah, has been found dead. A rescue operation was launched after Jetal Agnihotri went missing on August 19. Her body was found on Tuesday in the Virgin River after a thorough rescue operation by the rangers, officials said.

356.title: Maguire warned there's no guarantee over his Man United place: Reports
356.article_body: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire, who was dropped for the Liverpool match, has reportedly been warned by manager Erik Ten Hag that his place in the lineup is not guaranteed every week. According to reports, Ten Hag has suggested there will be rotation among the centre-backs. Earlier, Ten Hag had confirmed Maguire will remain United's captain for the season.

357.title: Want to challenge myself against Pant, he'd probably hit me for a six: Lee
357.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said he'd like to "challenge" himself against Rishabh Pant. "I had the pleasure of playing against Sachin Tendulkar...Pant would be very exciting to bowl to," added Lee. "He'd probably hit me for a six," he stated. Discussing Pant's unorthodox strokes, Lee had said he would have been "blowing up" if similar shots were played against him.

358.title: I don't think he's there yet: Styris on Shubman's place in India's T20I squad
358.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris has said Shubman Gill is not "there yet" to be included in India's T20I squad. "I think he will be [in the team], let's say 12 months from now. He's making his way nicely from the Test side through to the T20s," added Styris. Shubman scored his maiden ODI hundred in the recently-concluded Zimbabwe ODIs.

359.title: Leopard sighted again at Pune's DRDO facility, rescue operation on
359.article_body: The operation to rescue a leopard continued at a research and development facility of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) in Pune after the animal was sighted again late on Tuesday night. The leopard's movement was captured by a thermal camera in an area near a water tank. However, the immediate rescue of the animal could not be done.

360.title: 2 threaten to blow up Mumbai's Lalit Hotel, held from Gujarat
360.article_body: Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested two people from Gujarat for threatening to blow up Mumbai's Lalit Hotel. The duo called the hotel and said that bombs were placed at four places in the building and asked for ₹5 crore to defuse them, a police official said. Earlier, a police official had said that it appeared to be a hoax call.

361.title: Nancy Pelosi's husband sentenced to  5-day jail term for drunken driving
361.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul Pelosi, has been sentenced to five days in jail as he pleaded guilty to causing injury by drunken driving in California on May 28. A judge gave him four days' credit for good behaviour and the time he already served in jail. He has been ordered to perform eight hours of community service.

362.title: 'Godman' rapes woman, wife makes video in Karnataka; both booked
362.article_body: Karnataka Police booked a "godman" and his wife for allegedly sexually exploiting a woman for years. The main accused allegedly drugged and raped her, and his wife made a video of the act, police said. The "godman" met the victim at an event five years ago and told her something bad is going to happen to her and her family.

363.title: Japan plans to work on next-generation nuclear power plant: Reports
363.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has planned to call for development of a new-generation nuclear power plant, according to reports. The plan, likely to be announced during a Green Transformation meeting, comes at a time when fuel prices are rising. Japan kept most of its nuclear reactors non-operational since a tsunami triggered a disaster in Fukushima in 2011.

364.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine was 'reborn' when Russia invaded
364.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy delivered a speech during which he said that Ukraine had been "reborn" when Russia invaded in February. The recorded speech marked 31 years of independence and six-month anniversary of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Zelenskyy, 44-year-old wartime leader, said that Ukraine opposes any kind of compromise that would allow Moscow to lock in territorial gains.

365.title: FCI takes short-term loan of ₹22,000 crore to finance ops: Report
365.article_body: The Food Corporation of India (FCI) has reportedly availed of a short-term loan of ₹22,000 crore in the current financial year. FCI has taken the loan because the Finance Ministry has allocated around ₹52,000 crore under the food subsidy budget until now against expenses of over ₹75,000 crore. FCI avails of loans for 90 days to address cash flow mismatches.

366.title: Video captures moment 40-metre superyacht sinks off coast of Italy
366.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that captured the moment when a 40-metre superyacht completely sank into the Mediterranean Sea. The vessel sank off the coast of southern Italy and was heading from Gallipoli to Milazzo. While the reason the yacht sank is being investigated, the coast guard was able to rescue nine people from the ship.

367.title: China's battery firm CATL doubles profits in Q2 on high EV sales
367.article_body: Chinese battery maker, CATL, has more than doubled its profit in the second quarter as China announced incentives to boost sale of electric vehicles. According to Reuters, CATL made a net profit of $974.61 million from April to June, registering a 164% increase from a year ago. The company said that COVID-19 outbreak in various cities impacted its domestic market.

368.title: Singapore to ease indoor mask, 7-day quarantine requirements
368.article_body: Singapore's Health Ministry has said that it will ease requirements to wear masks indoors as the country's COVID-19 situation further stabilises. People will no longer be required to wear a face mask indoors, except on public transport and high-risk areas like medical facilities. Authorities have also decided to drop a seven-day quarantine rule for non-vaccinated travellers from next week.

369.title: Sisodia has no escape route, there's evidence he indulged in corruption: Patra
369.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) spokesperson Sambit Patra on Wednesday said that Delhi Deputy Chief Minister and AAP leader Manish Sisodia does not have an escape route. "There is evidence that he indulged in corruption," Patra added. "AAP is trying to deflect BJP's questions on malpractices in implementation of Delhi's liquor policy," Patra stated.

370.title: Pune man claims wife used black magic to control him, approaches court
370.article_body: A Pune court has taken cognisance of allegations made by a man against his wife and in-laws, claiming that they had carried out black magic to gain "control over him". The man in his complaint stated that he had found lemon, green chilies and charcoal in his cupboard. The court has ordered a probe under relevant sections of the CrPC.

371.title: Why has Thailand Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha been suspended?
371.article_body: Thailand PM Prayuth Chan-ocha was suspended from official duties by the country's Constitutional Court on Wednesday. The suspension came after the court decided to hear a petition seeking review of his legally mandated eight-year term limit. The petition, filed by the main opposition party, said Prayuth's time spent as head of a military junta should count towards his term.

372.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flags off 97 electric buses today
372.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal inaugurated 97 more electric buses at Rajghat Depot-I today, taking the total number of electric buses in Delhi Transport Corporation's (DTC) fleet to 249. Each one of the buses is estimated to cut 0.33 million tonnes of PM 2.5 and PM 10 carbon dioxide (CO2) each in its life span of 10 years, officials said.

373.title: Delhi AIIMS mess shut over unhygienic conditions reopened in an hour: Doctors
373.article_body: The hostel mess of Delhi AIIMS, shut by FSSAI over several irregularities and unhygienic conditions, was reopened within an hour, Resident Doctors Association (RDA) alleged. The administration didn't take any steps to address the issues, it claimed. RDA, in a letter to AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria, stated pests were found in food during a surprise inspection on August 10.

374.title: AAP MLAs being given threat of CBI and ED: Arvind Kejriwal
374.article_body: Addressing an inauguration event, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "In the last 2-3 days, some AAP MLAs have told me that they are being given the threat of CBI and ED." "They are being lured with money to leave AAP, this is a very serious issue. We have called a meeting of our political affairs at 4 pm," he added.

375.title: B'luru software engineers booked for raising pro-Pak slogans on Clubhouse
375.article_body: Two software engineers from Bengaluru have been booked for allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans on audio chat app Clubhouse on August 15 and August 16. The two had reportedly urged members who were part of the discussion to change their display picture to the Pakistan flag. However, police haven't made any arrests yet, stating those involved had no connection with Pakistan.

376.title: Farmer who sent workers home on a plane during lockdown found hanging in Delhi temple
376.article_body: A 55-year-old farmer who sent his workers home to Bihar on a plane during the 2020 COVID-19 lockdown was found hanging in a temple in Delhi on Wednesday. Pappan Singh Gehlot was found hanging at the temple in front of his house in the Alipore area of Delhi. Police officials also recovered a note.

377.title: This is lobbying: Vivek on Dylan Mohan calling 'Kashmir...' 'garbage'
377.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to Canadian filmmaker Dylan Mohan Gray's comments on his film 'The Kashmir Files'. "This is all lobbying and politics. My political acumen is better than most filmmakers...Tell me, how did someone sitting in Canada notice my film? That means somebody is lobbying," Vivek said. Dylan had called Vivek's film 'hate-mongering garbage'.

378.title: We're taking it seriously, DGP is monitoring: Goa CM on Sonali Phogat's death
378.article_body: Following BJP leader Sonali Phogat’s death in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "We're taking it seriously." He added, "DGP himself is monitoring. Investigation and post-mortem reports will come to him. Preliminary, as per doctors and DGP, it seems to be cardiac arrest," Sawant added. Phogat's sister Raman has said their family isn't ready to accept she died of heart attack.

379.title: Shooting of Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2' resumes after a 2-year gap
379.article_body: Filmmaker Shankar took to Twitter and announced that they have resumed the shoot of Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Indian 2' after two years. "We are glad to announce that the remaining shoot for 'Indian 2' is commencing today! Need all of your support and wishes," Shankar tweeted. The shoot halted in February 2020 after an accident on set killed three people.

380.title: Spent under ₹10 cr annually on promotions: Dolo 650 manufacturer amid freebies claim
380.article_body: Micro Labs, the manufacturer of Dolo 650, said that it spent under ₹10 crore annually on brand marketing and promotion. It added that the only freebies it gave out included books, pens and small mementoes. The company’s clarification comes at a time when it is being accused of offering freebies worth ₹1,000 crore to doctors to promote Dolo 650.

381.title: Finland's PM Sanna Marin apologises for pic of 2 topless women kissing at her residence
381.article_body: Finland's PM Sanna Marin has apologised for a photo taken at her official residence which showed two women kissing, lifting their tops to bare their torsos and covering their breasts with a sign reading 'Finland'. This comes after a video surfaced showing Marin partying with a group of friends and celebrities, after which she had to take a drug test.

382.title: KKR were 7 down, needed 80 runs; McCullum said 'Just 13 more sixes': Venkatesh
382.article_body: Recalling an anecdote from an IPL match where KKR had lost seven wickets with 80 runs required, KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said the franchise's former coach Brendon McCullum met the players and said, "Just 13 more sixes needed." "That...makes you feel that you will be able to achieve it," added Venkatesh. "McCullum doesn't let the pressure affect anyone," he stated.

383.title: Nobody can put pressure on 'Mahagathbandhan' govt: JD(U) MLC on CBI raids
383.article_body: JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar said the central government has used CBI and ED as government instruments after the CBI raided the residences of two RJD leaders. "Bihar is the land of democracy and [it] does not matter if you send a dozen agencies, there is no one to create pressure on 'Mahagathbandhan' government," Kumar added.

384.title: Even when I was coach we discussed we were a bit timid at the top: Shastri
384.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said India should continue with their "aggressive" approach in T20Is. "It's the right approach...If you start winning with this approach, you can take that confidence in big games," he added. "Even when I was coach, we discussed we were a bit timid at the top considering the players we had down the order," added Shastri.

385.title: Shaheen Bagh protest not independent movement, backed by PFI: Delhi Police to HC
385.article_body: The protests at Shaheen Bagh for Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) were not organic or an independent movement, Delhi Police told the Delhi High Court. Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) were behind the protests and locals did not support it at various places, the police said, adding that people were transferred to these sites.

386.title: BJP offered 4 AAP MLAs ₹20 cr each to switch sides: MP Sanjay Singh
386.article_body: BJP offered four AAP MLAs ₹20 crore each if they switched sides and ₹25 crore if they bring other party leaders with them, Delhi Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh claimed. "In Maharashtra, MLAs are protesting 'Khokha-Khokha 50 Khokha'," he added. "Like BJP formed government in Maharashtra, MP, Arunachal, Karnataka...Manipur, similar efforts are being made in Delhi," AAP's Durgesh Pathak said.

387.title: His craze increased due to The Kapil Sharma Show: Late singer KK's son
387.article_body: Late singer KK's son Nakul said his father's popularity had increased after his appearance on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. "After ['The Kapil Sharma Show'], the craze went even higher," he said. Daughter Taamara added, "Dad didn't do TV much, but after that, people were so happy to see him." KK had featured in the show with Shaan and Palash Sen.

388.title: Tata Sons may have to write-off AirAsia India's losses: Report
388.article_body: Tata Sons might have to make a ₹2,600 crore provision as accumulated losses for AirAsia India as Tata-owned Air India seeks to fully acquire the latter's equity share capital, according to a report. Tata Sons has 83.67% stake in AirAsia India. Whether the write-off will be included in Tata Sons or Air India's balance sheet is yet to be decided.

389.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates Asia's largest private hospital in Faridabad
389.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated Amrita Hospital in Faridabad's Sector-88. The 2,600-bed hospital, managed by Mata Amritanandamayi Math, is claimed to be Asia's largest private hospital. "The hospital, which is being constructed at an estimated cost of around ₹6,000 crore, will provide state-of-the-art healthcare facilities to the people of Faridabad and the entire NCR region," PM said.

390.title: Felt awkward buying pregnancy kit, everyone knew I just had baby: Debina
390.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee, who recently announced her second pregnancy, has revealed that she felt awkward while buying a pregnancy kit. "The whole world knows I just had a baby...I..ordered it online," she added. Debina further said that she was shocked, extremely happy and did not know what to do next after she got to know she was pregnant.

391.title: Deepak Chahar should be 'first-choice' pacer for India in Asia Cup: L Balaji
391.article_body: Ex-India pacer L Balaji has said pacer Deepak Chahar, who has been named among the back-ups for the Asia Cup, should be a "first-choice" bowler in the tournament. "In the UAE...the new ball skills are needed...If Bumrah and Shami are not available, Chahar is the one who provides that," stated Balaji. Chahar registered figures of 3/27 and 2/75 against Zimbabwe.

392.title: Police carries out flag march as protests erupt over Prophet remarks in Hyd
392.article_body: The Telangana Police on Wednesday carried out a flag march in Hyderabad after protests erupted against suspended BJP leader T Raja Singh. Meanwhile, all petrol pumps across parts of Hyderabad Old City were closed amid the protests. This comes after Raja Singh was granted bail hours after his arrest on Tuesday over his alleged remarks against Islam and Prophet Muhammad.

393.title: BEST will operate additional buses during Ganeshotsav, double-deckers for Lalbaug
393.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) will launch buses from 11 pm to 6 am to help devotees have 'darshans' of various idols during Ganeshotsav. The authorities have launched over 3,300 MSRTC bus routes to meet the demands starting at month-end. BEST is also planning to run double-deckers from 10 pm to 6 am for several areas including Lalbaug.

394.title: Release of Bilkis' convicts shows our failure, I will request PM to undo it: BJP leader
394.article_body: Senior BJP leader Shanta Kumar has criticised the Gujarat government for releasing the 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. He said, "I'll request the Prime Minister to use his influence to undo this remission...it shows our failed commitment to protecting women." He also said, "I bow my head in shame", adding that the convicts should be hanged.

395.title: Hearing this from media: Gehlot on reports of being offered Cong chief post
395.article_body: Amid reports that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has been offered the Congress President post by the party's President Sonia Gandhi, Gehlot said, "I'm hearing this from the media." He added, "I don't know about this. I am fulfilling duties that have been assigned to me." Earlier, Gehlot had said that Rahul Gandhi should accept Congress President’s post.

396.title: Sundaram Mutual launches Sundaram Flexi Cap Fund, NFO closes Aug 30
396.article_body: Sundaram Mutual launched an open-ended equity scheme, Sundaram Flexi Cap NFO closing on August 30. "Flexi Cap Funds can outperform over market cycles. They allow for greater diversification & investors can stay invested in the best cap curves, sectors, stocks across all market scenarios, relaxing while the fund manager optimizes opportunities for them," said Sunil Subramaniam, MD, Sundaram Mutual.

397.title: Waited for 8 hrs due to discussion on Shahid's shoes: Kiara on Kabir Singh
397.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said she b**ch-slapped Shahid Kapoor, who was her co-star in 'Kabir Singh', "in her head" as she had to "wait for eight hours" due to a discussion on Shahid's shoes for a scene. Kiara revealed this during an episode of 'Koffee with Karan 7', where Shahid was present. Host Karan Johar said he'd have done the same.

398.title: Twitter merges misinformation & spam teams amid whistleblower’s claims
398.article_body: Twitter is combining its health experience and the Twitter service teams to reduce toxic content and spam bots amid claims by whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko. The 'health' team works on reducing misinformation and harmful content, while the service team reviews reported profiles and takes down spam accounts. The new group will be called 'Health Products and Services'.

399.title: HPCL starts work on first cow dung-based compressed biogas project
399.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) on Tuesday started its first cow dung-to-compressed biogas project in Rajasthan's Sanchore. Under the GOBAR-Dhan scheme, the plant will utilise 100 tonnes of cow dung per day to produce biogas, which will then be used as automotive fuel. The plant is slated to be commissioned in a year. The groundbreaking ceremony took place in Pathmeda.

400.title: Clickbait journalism: Meesho CEO on report claiming company planning a down round
400.article_body: Addressing a media report alleging Meesho evaluating a down round at a valuation at least 25% down from its last funding round, CEO Vidit Aatrey called it a "false" story. Aatrey wrote, "Sad to see this clickbait journalism. Fabricating stories about townhalls that never happened to "source driven" fake anecdotes of a down round...Be more responsible about what you write".
